intro: Conospermum nervosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves with a distinctive veining pattern. It produces showy, bottlebrush-like inflorescences in shades of pink or red. Conospermum nervosum is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry woodland habitats.
